args:
Sylas and Laxi arrive at a theater in the city to
deliver some aromatic herbs to the playwright
Marley. But the moment Marley sees Laxi,
he begs her to take the lead role in his play!
Sensing the heart within the work, Laxi accepts.
C'mon, guys! 'Tis the season for teasin'!\nLet's live it up a little, yeah?
Seriously, what's with you two sad sacks?\nYou're really harshing my vibe over here.
Then let the vibe perish. I haven't the time\nto deal with you—I have aromatic herbs\nto deliver.
I will accompany you; I cannot be caught\nup in Luca's pranks if I wander far away.\n▷Not sure you need to go THAT far...◁
Well, exCUSE me. I just... I just wanted\nyou to have fun... That's all I ever\nwanted... *sob*
*sigh* If you want us to have fun, Luca,\nI suppose I could be talked into—

Yeah, Malora taught me a new trick where
you pretend to sob like a baby until the
other person gives you whatever you want,
and I am AMAZING at it!
The client asked us to meet here, but I\nwasn't expecting so many people...
This is the first time I have been\nin a crowd of this size.\n▷What is this place, anyway?◁

It's the local theater. Thespians from the
world over come here to sing and act and
cavort and whatnot. Now then, I believe
the rear entrance is riiight...over there.
My client should be just... Hmm?
Me too! I know we've gotten through all\nmanner of problems before, but I am\nNOT going through this again!
It's over, Marley. Let's just give up on this\nshow and move on to the next one.
No! I'll make sure the script and set are\nready by Halloween. Same for the actors.\nI just need to find some new leads is all!
With a month left before opening night?\nGood luck.
I can make it happen. I know it.

All right, all right. But if you don't have
two new actors pronto, I'm axing this
little production and moving on to
The Merry Wives of Alberia. Got it?
Oh, whatever am I going to—\n*COUGH* *HACK* *WHEEEEEZE*
Begging your pardon. Are you Marley?
*cough* Yes. And who might you be?
Sylas. I received a letter saying you\nneeded aromatic herbs to help with\na chronic illness?
You came! Oh, what a relie—*HAAACK*
From the sounds of it, you need these\nherbs rather badly.
Yes, I suppose I do. I'm a playwright,\nyou see, and I've been pushing myself\nso hard it caused a flare-up.
But I just can't afford to go to a hospital.\nI must finish this script, no matter what!
(He certainly seems to have his reasons\nfor this, but it would be rude to ask.)

I understand. In that case, let's get to an
empty room where I can begin treatment.
My companion is securing us one at the
theater as we speak.
I found a suitable room over there.

Forgive me, but your doll costume is
simply amazing—you even have the
proper ball joints and everything!
How DID you pull that off?!
It moved! The joints actually moved!\nBut how can that be poss—*WHEEEZE*
We can talk about Laxi later. Right now,\nwe need to get you treated.
Ahhh... I never thought I'd be able to\nbreathe so easily again. Your aromatics\nare truly incredible, Sylas.
But what's even more incredible is...\nI'm sorry, what was your name? Laxi?\nYour story is simply astounding.
You're one of the combat androids\nmentioned in ancient texts, yes?
A conditional affirmative. However,\nI was not created in ancient times.
I see, I see. Still, I never thought I'd meet\nan elaborate creation such as yourself!
...Laxi, I have a favor to ask.\nMight you indulge me?
You must act in the lead role of my play!
What is this?\n▷It's handwritten—and there's\nso darn MUCH of it!◁
That is a script, although it appears to be\nunfinished. Are you writing this, Marley?
I am. It is a new production we plan\nto debut on Halloween entitled\n＂Philosophia's Monster.＂
It takes place in a world unlike our own—\none filled with unimaginable wonders\nsuch as ＂electricity!＂
The main character in this play is the\ncreation of a man—a clockwork creature.
The creation of a man...\n▷Just like us!◁
Well, I suppose it would add a certain\nsense of realism to have a man-made\ncreation playing that same role.
Wouldn't it just?! Alas, we've had so many\nmishaps, production is at a standstill.\nIn fact, I just lost my two leads.
But if you were to perform, we'd have a\nchance to regale the world with this\ntale of wonder after all!
I'll write the lines to fit you, so it won't be\na difficult performance. What do you say?
...How did you research and develop\nthis play?

Research? Develop? This is ART,
not a science project! A writer merely
needs to put pen to paper and let their
thought flow forth!
That is illogical. One cannot\ncreate a heart so easily.

The leaders of the androids are equipped
with ego circuits known as ＂hearts.＂
They allow us to output emotional data
and determine right from wrong.

Said data, which mimics human emotion,
can then be shared amongst ourselves,
allowing us to give complex reports and
situational assessments.
This ＂play＂ is also attempting to output\nemotions and share them with others.\nTherefore, it has a heart.
I am very confused right now...
▷Er, I think what Laxi is trying to say is\nthat she finds this play entertaining.◁
Entertaining? So being able to share\nemotions with something intangible is\nbeing ＂entertained by the arts?＂
▷Uh, kind of? But I think it's more that\nsharing one's emotions and empathizing\nwith them is vital to the arts.◁

I partially understand. However, Marley
claimed that the script was unfinished,
which means the sharing of emotions
is, by definition, incomplete...
...If I were to perform in your play,\ncould I see the rest of the script?

Of course! If you take part, that will be
one less thing for me to worry about,
and I can then focus all of my energy
on completing it!

At present, no one in this world can
manufacture a heart. Additionally,
there remain many mysteries hidden
within the depths of our circuits.
By helping you create this script, I may\nbe able to understand more about the\nheart inside myself.
Decision confirmed. I will join your play.
You DO realize that traipsing about a stage\nwon't actually give you any hints into the\ninner workings of an android, yes?
▷Well, we still get to help someone\nout, so...you know! Ha ha ha...ha?◁
I have put on my costume.\nDoes it look good on me?
Yes, it looks quite nice. Er, but...

Stupendous! Marvelous! Simply titanic!
When I see you standing there, my dear,
I feel the wings of hope stir in my breast
anew!
Then I will help more. What can I do?
Hmm. Well, even if I can find other actors,\nwe still haven't finished the set.
You lack a set? This just gets better\nand better...
What's with that look, Laxi?\nEr, and you don't need to actually\nsay the word ＂stare,＂ you know.
You have to come here to treat Marley\nevery day. You have time to help.
Yes, but I only make aromatics!\nI know nothing of the theater or—
Oh, fine! I'll help with finding the\nnecessary materials and building\nthe set. Will that make you happy?
Affirmative.\n▷Ha ha...haaaaa. Sorry about this.\nLaxi's being a bit stubborn today.◁

Oh, I suppose it's all right. Once this play
is finished, Marley can stop pushing
himself so much, which means my work
here will be done all the faster.
Thank you both so much. Now let us go\nand make this play a reality—this is one\nshow that will DEFINITELY go on!
